People who feel they have a say in what the government does or are confident to participate in politics also express higher trust in the national government (en)

Slightly more than one third believe that parliament fairly balances the interests of different groups when debating a policy (en)

A large majority is satisfied with administrative services (en)
Share of recent users reporting different levels of satisfaction with administrative services in their country, 2023 (en)

On average, a higher share of people in higher-income countries compared to lower-income countries believe government institutions are prepared for emergencies (en)

Share of population in country who find it likely that government institutions are ready to protect lives in case of a large-scale emergency (y-axis) and purchasing power adjusted GDP per capita (x-axis), 2023 (en)
In many countries, perceptions about the responsiveness of public institutions to innovative ideas have remained relatively stable (en)

Confidence in their country’s ability to reduce greenhouse gas emissions slightly increased in many countries (en)
Share of population reporting different levels of confidence in government’s ability to succeed in reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the next ten years (en)
Satisfaction with education system remained relatively stable in many countries, but declined sharply in some (en)
Share of population with recent contact with the education system reporting different levels of satisfaction with the education system in their country, 2021 and 2023 (en)

More people find it likely that their own application for government benefits would be treated fairly than public employees would treat all people equally regardless of background (en)

Trust in all public institutions is lower for people who did not vote for a party in power (en)
Share of population with high or moderately high trust in different public institutions by whether people voted for the government or not, 2023 (en)

Individuals with higher levels of education tend to have more trust in the national government (en)
Share of population with high or moderately high trust in the national government by respondents’ education, 2023 (en)
People are more confident in their government’s reliability than its integrity and responsiveness (en)

Share of population expressing confidence in government reliability, responsiveness, openness, integrity, fairness and ability to address complex and/or global policy challenges (average across survey questions), OECD, 2023 (en)
The share of the population who either do not trust the government at all or who have high trust has declined (en)
Share of population who indicate different levels of trust in their national government (on a 0-10 scale), 2021 and 2023 (en)
Trust in the local government is usually higher than trust in the regional and national governments (en)

OECD Survey on Drivers of Trust in Public Institutions – 2024 Results (en)
Building Trust in a Complex Policy Environment (en)
Less time consuming and confrontational modes of participation are more widespread (en)

More people distrust rather than trust the news media (en)
Share of population who indicate different levels of trust in news media, 2023 (en)
In all countries, feelings of economic insecurity correspond to lower trust in the national government (en)
Share of population with high or moderately high trust in the national government by financial concerns, 2023 (en)
An average of four in ten are confident their country will reduce greenhouse gas emissions (en)

Providing equal opportunities for all and creating the conditions for businesses to thrive are seen as policy areas that countries should prioritise (en)
Share of population who think it is important that their country prioritises the respective goal, OECD, 2023 (en)
The police and judicial system are the most trusted institutions (en)

Perceptions of service responsiveness to complaints about public services remained almost the same on average between 2021 and 2023 (en)
Share of population who find it likely or unlikely that governments improve public services if many people complain, 2021 and 2023 (en)

Share of population who find it likely or unlikely that a public agency would use their personal data for legitimate purposes only, 2021 and 2023 (en)

Share of population who find it likely or unlikely that the national government would clearly explain how the respondent would be affected by a reform, 2023 (en)
A slightly declining share believe that their own application for a government benefit would be treated fairly (en)
Share of population who find it likely or unlikely that their application for government benefits/services would be treated fairly, 2021 and 2023 (en)
Readers of the written press are more likely to trust the government (en)

Four in ten find it likely that the government takes decisions based on the best available evidence, research and data (en)

Confidence in governments’ emergency preparedness increased in a majority of OECD countries (en)
Share of population who find it likely or unlikely that their government is ready to protect people’s lives in case of emergency (2023) or a new serious contagious disease (2021) (en)

Building Trust in a Complex Policy Environment (en)

Higher confidence in having a say is correlated with higher trust in the national government (en)
The modest shift in the average with high or moderately high trust across the OECD hides important differences across countries (en)

People who identify as belonging to a group that is discriminated against in the country have lower expectations of fair treatment (en)

A slightly larger share of the population has low or no trust in their national government compared to those with high or moderately high trust (en)
